business.headline: Looking for tax-saving options? Check out these 5 post office savings schemesAmong various tax-saving methods, post office savings schemes are considered one of the safest investment options since they are backed by the government.
Wall Street holds steadier following weeks of scary swingsThe S&P 500 was 0.1% higher after falling for four consecutive weeks amid Donald Trump's tariff threats to overseas markets.

'Stagflation' fears grow as US Fed prepares key interest rate decisionThe Federal Reserve faces rising inflation concerns and economic uncertainty ahead of its meeting. Potential stagflation complicates rate-cut plans, while higher tariffs and consumer inflation fears add pressure on policymakers and financial markets.

Wall Street witnesses modest gains as investors await Fed's rate decisionAt the opening bell, the S&P 500 increased 27.46 points, or 0.49%, to 5,666.40 and the Nasdaq Composite rose 59.43 points, or 0.33%, to 17,813.51. The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed 203.34 points, or 0.50%, to 41,695.55.

Banking operations may be hit on March 24 and 25. Here's whyThe UFBU, a group representing nine major bank unions, announced the strike after failing to reach an agreement with the Indian Banks' Association (IBA).

Got credit card reward points? 4 ways to use themWhile most people use credit card reward points for shopping rewards, travel benefits, or cashback, they can also be used as a handy means to pay bills, including bill payments.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as healthcare and financial stocks boost marketThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 341.04 points to close at 74,169.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 111.55 points to end at 22,508.75.

Ola Electric share price tanks over 7%: Should you buy, sell or hold?Ola Electric share price: The stock dropped to a record low of Rs 46.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in early trade. By 3:00 pm, it was trading at Rs 46.95, down 7.10%.

New pension rules: Know how divorced and separated daughters can benefitThese changes aim to encourage women's participation in governance and administration and ensure financial independence for widows and separated women.

High Court clears Gautam Adani, brother in Rs 388 crore market violation caseThe case dates back to 2012 when the Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) filed a chargesheet against Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) and its promoters, accusing them of criminal conspiracy and cheating.

Why financial investments make a better inheritance over antiques and businessFinancial investments like savings, stocks, bonds, and mutual funds are easy to inherit through a will or nomination. They can be easily transferred through a will or nomination, giving your children financial flexibility and immediate access to funds.
Who is Shark Tank India's new judge Srikanth Bolla? All you need to knowSrikanth Bolla will now be part of Shark Tank India's panel that evaluates and invests in promising business ideas.

entertainment.headline: Malaika Arora scolds contestant for inappropriate danceActor Malaika Arora recently scolded a 16-year-old contestant for his inappropriate dance moves. Malaika asked for the contestant's mother's number.

Hina Khan emotional as boyfriend Rocky calls her a 'brave soul' amid cancer battleActor Hina Khan's boyfriend Rocky Jaiswal recently appeared on Celebrity MasterChef. Rocky spoke about Hina;s cancer battle and called her a 'braveheart.'

Salman Khan's nephew Ayaan on stage name Agni and fighting the nepotism tagBollywood superstar Salman Khan's nephew, Ayaan Agnihotri, recently made his music debut. In an exclusive conversation with India Today Digital, the actor opened up about his stage name and battling the nepotism tag.

Exclusive: Tayme on The White Lotus S3, Lisa of Blackpink, Asian representationTayme Thapthimthong's journey from a real-life security guard to a celebrated actor in The White Lotus Season 3 is truly remarkable. Paired with Blackpink's Lisa, Tayme, in an exclusive chat with India Today speaks about his journey, Asian representation and more.

Kim Kardashian vs Kanye West: Rapper fights with ex-wife over daughter's nameKanye West released a song featuring daughter North, despite Kim Kardashian's objections. She took legal action, but Kanye leaked their private chat and refused to back down, escalating their feud.
After CID, Crime Patrol begins to stream on Netflix, fans reactCrime Patrol, the iconic true-crime series on Sony TV, is now available to stream on Netflix. Fans reacted to the announcement.

Kim Soo-hyun and Kim Sae-ron controversy: Exposing Korean industry's double standardsThe controversy involving South Korean actors Kim Soo-hyun and the late Kim Sae-ron has opened a Pandora's box of issues within the entertainment industry, from age-gap relationships to the treatment of disgraced celebrities. As the public grapples with these revelations, the debate continues to rage on about ethics, consent, and gender double standards.

Kim Soo-hyun's agency acts against Indian blogger for unauthorised contentIn a dramatic turn of events, actor Kim Soo-hyun's agency has initiated legal proceedings against an Indian influencer. The influencer shared emails from the agency, revealing that he was threatened for posting 'unauthorised' content.

Hina Khan performs Umrah amid cancer battle, says she's 'overwhelmed, speechless'Actor Hina Khan performed Umrah amid her cancer battle. She shared emotional moments from Mecca on Instagram. Accompanied by her brother, the actor expressed gratitude and prayed for strength while documenting her journey.

Kim Soo-hyun's scenes cut from 'Good Day' following Kim Sae-ron controversyK-drama actor Kim Soo-hyun's scenes from MBC's variety program 'Good Day' were edited after Kim Sae-ron controversy. The production house shared a statement and confirmed the same.

TV actor Erica Fernandes says Do Patti triggered memories of abusive relationshipActor Erica Fernandes shared her experience of physical abuse in a past relationship, highlighting how films like Do Patti resurfaced painful memories. Despite the challenges, she opened up about her journey towards healing and the societal pressures that kept her silent.

Sidhu Moose Wala's little brother's Holi pic goes viral. Seen yet?A viral photo of Sidhu Moose Wala's little brother, Shubhdeep, dressed in traditional attire with Holi colours on his cheeks, has captured the hearts of fans on social media.

All Of Us Are Dead actor Lomon on India: I think of Taj Mahal and Bengal TigersSouth Korean actor Lomon, known for his role in All of Us Are Dead, discussed his latest project Family Matters and shared insights on his career and inspirations in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital.

Hina Khan shares pic of discoloured nails: Most common side effect of chemotherapyTelevision actor Hina Khan opened up about the side effects of chemotherapy on her nails, sharing a glimpse of the discolouration.

Saira Banu says she shouldn't be called AR Rahman's ex-wife: We're not divorcedSaira Banu, wife of AR Rahman, clarifies that they are separated but not divorced, addressing recent rumours. She cites her health issues as a reason and wishes Rahman well.

Priyanka Chahar Choudhary-Ankit Gupta unfollow each other, fans speculate break-upTelevision actors Priyanka Chahar Choudhary and Ankit Gupta, known for their chemistry on Udaariyaan, have unfollowed each other on Instagram, sparking rumours about their relationship status.

AR Rahman discharged from hospital, son shares health updateAR Rahman's son Ameen shared an update on the music maestro's health, explaining his hospitalisation was due to dehydration. He assured fans that Rahman is now recovering well. India Today Digital has learnt that the composer has also been discharged.

Watch: Actor Aamir Ali plays Holi with girlfriend Ankita KukretiTelevision actor Aamir Ali was seen celebrating Holi with his girlfriend Ankita Kukreti.  The couple's public appearance comes after Aamir confirmed his relationship status in a recent interview.

Ted Lasso returns: Jason Sudeikis show renewed for fourth seasonApple TV+ has renewed Ted Lasso for a fourth season with Jason Sudeikis leading the charge once more. The new season will introduce Ted coaching a women's football team.

general news.headline: Israel launches extensive airstrikes on Gaza, Palestine claims over 100 killedAt least 100 people were killed as Israeli airstrikes hit Gaza, breaking a fragile ceasefire since January. The attacks targeted Gaza City, Deir al-Balah, Khan Younis, and Rafah in the most intense bombardment since the truce began.

Aurangzeb row: How rumours of holy book desecration fuelled Nagpur violenceNagpur violence: Several vehicles were torched in large-scale arson and vandalism as two communities clashed in Nagpur. The administration has banned large gatherings.
Sunita Williams to begin her long-awaited journey back home today  Live UpdatesSunita Williams is returning aboard SpaceX Dragon spacecraft with astronaut Butch Willmore and two other Crew-9 members.

Curfew imposed in Manipur's Churachandpur after tribal leader assaultedTensions rose in Manipur's Churachandpur after a Hmar tribe leader was assaulted by unidentified individuals. The Hmar Inpui demanded swift justice and warned of action if its demands were not fulfilled.

Indian Green Card holders facing scrutiny, expulsion threat. 5 big pointsGreen Card holders are facing intense scrutiny and the threat of expulsion and deportation. Green Card-holding Indian senior citizens, who spend some months in India, are among those being grilled on their return. A German Green Card holder was recently stripped and "violently interrogated". Here are five big points on the issue.

South Sudan airstrike kills 19, clashes escalate near Ethiopia borderA South Sudanese airstrike in Nasir killed at least 19 people, escalating tensions with the White Army militia and raising fears of renewed civil war.

Aurangzeb row: 30 injured in violent clashes in Nagpur, 65 rioters detainedViolent clashes broke out in Nagpur after protests by Hindu groups demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb. Vehicles were set ablaze, and stones were thrown. Police and officials blamed rumours for the unrest, urging calm.

PM Modi meets Tulsi Gabbard, says India, US committed to combating terrorismPrime Minister Narendra Modi met US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard in New Delhi on Monday and presented her with Ganga water from the Maha Kumbh, which attracted over 660 million people in Prayagraj.

Still using baby cream as a moisturiser? It's time to stopMany people still rely on baby products to keep their skin soft, supple, and flawless—just like a baby's. But did you even check with your dermatologist if doing so is benefitting your skin?

2 students climb onto water tank in Maharashtra, die after it collapsesTwo students, aged 12 years, died after they climbed onto a water tank that collapsed on them in Maharashtra's Palghar district. Another student suffered critical injuries.

Watch: New Zealand PM's Champions Trophy final quip leaves PM Modi in splitsNew Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon joked that cricket was off the table during his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Monday. India defeated Zealand in the Champions Trophy final on March 09.

Direct dialogue happening at very top: Tulsi Gabbard on US's India tariffs threatIndia and the US have established a "direct dialogue at the very top" on the issue of tariffs, US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard said while reacting to US President Donald Trump's tariff threat on India.

Don't pull an Orry! 15 mistakes you shouldn't make during Vaishno Devi YatraAfter influencer Orry and 7 others were booked for drinking in Katra, the focus has shifted to the rules one must follow during Vaishno Devi yatra. Here are the essential dos and don'ts.

Married Ranya Rao in November, separated month later, husband tells courtRanya Rao's husband Jatin Hukkeri applied for exemption from arrest in the gold smuggling case saying the couple separated a month after getting married in November.

'State law and order has collapsed': Nagpur clash sparks opposition outrageViolent clashes in Nagpur have sparked criticism from opposition leaders, who blame the BJP-led Maharashtra government for a collapse in law and order.

Hathras professor accused of sexual assault by students, obscene videos surfaceSeveral female students of a UP college accused a professor, Rajneesh Kumar, of sexual exploitation. Obscene videos and photos of the professor have sparked social media outrage.

March Madness as Balochistan blows upMarch has been a fireworks display in Pakistan's north and south, and the military is running around like a headless chicken. Baloch rebels launched 57 attacks in the last 48 hours. A lethal combo has got the secessionists humming "mauka, mauka".

PM Modi joins Truth Social, thanks 'friend' Trump for podcast endorsementPrime Minister Narendra Modi joined US President Donald Trump-owned Truth Social and thanked him for uploading his full podcast with American podcaster Lex Fridman that was released on Sunday.

Met MS Dhoni recently at a wedding, asked about his IPL readiness at 43: HarbhajanIPL 2025: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh said MS Dhoni is as hungry as ever to play in the IPL and enjoy his cricket. Dhoni, 43, will return to play for the Chennai Super Kings in the new season, starting March 22.

Ranya Rao's father Ramachandra Rao questioned in gold smuggling caseKannada actor Ranya Rao's father, Ramachandra Rao, has been questioned in the gold smuggling case. The government-directed probe is nearing completion, with a report expected within two days.
Why students oppose a 400-acre green lung's auction in HyderabadThe University of Hyderabad students and green activists claim the move will disrupt the city's ecological balance.

Kim Soo-hyun and Kim Sae-ron controversy: Exposing Korean industry's double standardsThe controversy involving South Korean actors Kim Soo-hyun and the late Kim Sae-ron has opened a Pandora's box of issues within the entertainment industry, from age-gap relationships to the treatment of disgraced celebrities. As the public grapples with these revelations, the debate continues to rage on about ethics, consent, and gender double standards.

Intel to fire several employees, company says need to make tough decisionsIntel's incoming CEO Lip-Bu Tan has considered significant changes to its chip manufacturing methods and artificial intelligence strategies ahead of his return to the company on Tuesday, two people familiar with Tan's thinking told Reuters, in a sweeping bid to revive the ailing technology giant.

Telugu first but Hindi useful: Chandrababu Naidu backs three-language policyReiterating his stance on the three-language formula, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu said politics should not colour learning. He also stressed that Telugu must come first, but Hindi and English are useful for communication.

Janhvi Kapoor's boyfriend Shikhar blasts casteist troll over 'Tu dalit hai' remarkJanhvi Kapoor's boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya slammed a troll who left a casteist remark on his Diwali post on Instagram. His measured response calling the troll out for the 'Tu dalit hai (you are a Dalit)' comment won many hearts.
Watch: Superstar Rajinikanth, Lokesh Kanagaraj wrap up CoolieRajinikanth and director Lokesh Kanagaraj wrapped up the shooting of Coolie on March 17. The film will hit theatres later this year.

Aimee Lou Wood explains keeping her Manchester accent in 'The White Lotus'Aimee Lou Wood kept her Manchester accent in The White Lotus Season 3 at Mike White's request. She reassures fans she can do an American accent but found it unnecessary for the role.

Ben Folds announces 2025 'A Piano Tour' – Two NY shows confirmedBen Folds will bring his Ben Folds & A Piano Tour to New York in June 2025, performing at the Capitol Theatre and Tarrytown Music Hall. Tickets go on sale March 14.

sports.headline: IPL Multiverse: What if Virat Kohli was signed by Delhi Capitals in 2008Delhi Capitals in 2008 passed on the chance to sign hometown hero Virat Kohli and the star batter went on to be snapped up by Royal Challengers Bengaluru. The IPL Multiverse takes a look at what would have happened if Delhi signed Kohli instead of Bengaluru.
Iona Cuts Ties with Tobin Anderson After Two Seasons at the HelmAnderson's brief tenure ends amid struggles to sustain the program's momentum following Rick Pitino's departure.

NCAA Tournament: Massive TV rating and attendance for Women's basketballThere was concern that attendance and overall interest in women's college basketball would drop this year with the departure of Caitlin Clark, Angel Reese and other stars for the WNBA. However, there is a strong rating and attendance seen for women's basketball.

F1 teams set for stricter tests to avoid flexi-wing loopholeFormula 1's governing body, the FIA will implement tougher wing tests from the Chinese GP to prevent teams from exploiting flexible rear wings to gain an advantage.

Rory McIlroy secures second Players Championship titleRory Mcllory clinches his second players' championship title and builds momentum for the masters.  McIlroy delivered an early knockout against J.J. Spaun with his best drive of the week that set up a simple birdie.

Lionel Messi ruled out of World Cup qualifiers due to injuryArgentine talisman Lionel Messi has been ruled out of the FIFA World Cup qualifiers due to an indisclosed injury. Messi will be missing two crucial matches against Uruguay and Argentina in the coming days.

NCAA Tournament: Who won and Lost in Selection Sunday?The 2025 NCAA Men's and Women's Basketball tournament selections were unveiled on Sunday, March 16, with the field of 68 teams now set to compete for the trophy.

NBA: Anthony Davis assigned to G League as Mavericks star eyes return from InjuryThe Dallas Mavericks have sent Anthony Davis to the G-league, Texas Legends, in a major step towards his return from a strained left adductor. Davis is set to attend 5-on-5 scrimmages as he builds up for his NBA return.

IOC Board approves boxing for inclusion in 2028 Los Angeles Olympic GamesThe International Olympic Committee's (IOC) executive board approved the inclusion of boxing in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics. Boxing returns for its third straight Olympics despite the IOC derecognising IBA In 2023.

Swiss Open Badminton Live Streaming: When and where to watch Lakshya Sen, PV SindhuThe Swiss Open badminton is set to start from March 18. A host of Indian players are participating in the tournament. But will the Indian fans be able to watch the broadcast of the tournament?

Davis is set to attend 5-on-5 scrimmages as he builds up for his NBA return.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
